availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of James C. Loyall and Susanna Carter Loyall. Married to Susan Skaggs Loyall. Father of Elizabeth S. Loyall, James Loyall, Eliza J. Loyall, John T. Loyall, Mary E. Loyall, William L. Loyall, Sarah F. Loyall, and Martha A. Loyall. Farmer in Green County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Green County in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 133B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 671.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Upper Brush Creek, p. 521A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Martha T. Houk and Judy Froggett, comps., Cemeteries of Green County, Kentucky, Volume I (Greensburg, KY: The Green County Library, 1981), p. 32.
